name: Loblaw Pharmacy
address: Loblaw Pharmacy, 1301 Lougheed Hwy., Coquitlam, BC V3K 6P9

featured_reviews.review_id:
I tried to get my prescription here and they told me it was expired? I had only had it placed there 2 months ago, and was told prescriptions legally have to be on file for 2 years before expiring by my doctor.
This isn't my first issue with this pharmacy either, I'll be going somewhere else, many other options out there.
featured_reviews.review_text:

featured_reviews.review_id: Worst pharmacy service I've ever received. After sitting there chatting for 20 minutes while I waited in their view, 3 of them, I was finally served by an arrogant condescending man who treated me like I was in the wrong for finally saying excuse me. I could hear what you're talking about, it was not work related, sir. However, my attendance to your location is, do your job! He then proceeded to give me vague answers and sigh repeatedly as I asked the difference between medications so I could choose one to purchase. The judgemental arrogant attitude I received, coupled with the fact he told me I couldn't get my inhaler filled until the next day (it was only 4pm) even tho I told him I was short of breath and it's just ventolin that I ALREADY HAVE A REFILL ON FILE FOR, leads me to give them a 1/10. I have several other negative experiences too this is not a one off. This is a terrible pharmacy who doesn't care about their patients health, just about their profits.

featured_reviews.review_id: I've never written a negative review before, but I thought I should warn that I've had a number of needlessly tense interactions at this pharmacy while simply refilling medications. There are some nice staff as well so I don't want to paint too broad a brush, but multiple staff made the process of just picking up medications a pain -- switching pharmacies now.

There are some nice staff as well so I don't want to paint too broad a brush, but multiple staff made the process of just picking up medications a pain -- switching pharmacies now.

featured_reviews.review_id: The pharmacist Mr Ahmed is the rudest person I have ever met. He isn't patient and with his body language and tone of voice he shows he is not happy with his job. I turned in a complaint letter to the manager and apparently nothing happened. People like Mr Ahmee shouldn't work in customer service. His rude attitude deters people from coming to the pharmacy in the hope not to come across with him.

featured_reviews.review_id: Exactly  I feel mistreated and disrespected at this pharmacy. They don't have your meds ready or tell my dad he has already picked up his heart meds when he is out of them. This man the manager is a rude guy pretty much told me to my face I was lying. If u dint have too deal with this rude pharmacy I wouldn't choose it. Til they learn compassion and respect.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely the worst. Always a long wait, perscriptions are NEVER ready when they say, if you do a renewal on the phone they have no record of it when you go to pick it up.
featured_reviews.review_text: Absolutely the worst. Always a long wait, perscriptions are NEVER ready when they say, if you do a renewal on the phone they have no record of it when you go to pick it up.

featured_reviews.review_id: When I asked the doctor to explain how to use the medicine, he (mr ahmad)started talking very rudely and mockingly. Unfortunately, I had a very bad experience with this pharmacy and him. This is not the first time this has happened and they did not know how can use my insurance

featured_reviews.review_id: This is the worst pharmacy ever. It is not enough that you have to wait for 45 min to pick your medication ( I came 48 hours after my confirmed pickup date) I also have to wait for 30 min on the phone to fill in my prescription cause someone very smart at loblaw decided that the online refill system is too good and customers were using it to save their and the staff time so they decommissioned the system a year ago without putting another one in place. By far the worst
